however these men may be persecuted and

they are the only men who do not

link between the world and the church

into the world and now the last link

at an independent process of life is

is unquestionably bound up with a
doctrine of the Christ our European

consciousness so terrified and confused
is undergoing when a newborn baby does
it tosses about turning from side to
side crying and not knowing what it is

former nourishment is dried up but what
does not yet what to look for a new one
it is thus with our European world
see what a complicated seemingly

they have not found a new one they seek

formerly flowed into the world through

Christ was a religion that defines life
and gives an expression of human life
stands now as it did eighteen hundred

church which while hiding the doctrine
from their eyes seemed to suffice for
its life but now the time has come when
the church has served its time and the

Christ Christ teaches us first of all to

in us Christ teaches men the place is
light of reason above all else to live

it is impossible to struggle against it
it is impossible to refuse to accept it
it is impossible to refuse a doctrine of
Christ because it encompasses all the
errors in which men live and like the
ether which those who study the

penetrates all the doctrine of Christ is
essential for each whatever position he
may be in Christ's doctrine must be
accepted by men not because it is

they wish to live as rational beings the

in the explanation of gifts of a sense
of life but in the doctrine of life that
flows out of it the metaphysical
teaching of Christ is not new it is a

of man and that all the truly wise men
of the world preach but the power of
Christ's doctrine lies in the practical
application of this metaphysical
teaching to life the metaphysical
foundation of the teaching of the
ancient Hebrews and of that of Christ is
the same love to God and love to our
neighbor but the application of this
doctrine to life according to Moses and
according to law of Christ is very
different according to law of Moses it
was necessary to fulfill 613
commandments including some most
senseless and cruel ones all based upon
the authority of the scripture according
to the law of Christ the teaching that
flows out of the same metaphysical basis
is expressed in five rational
commandments which carry their own
meaning and their own justification
along with them and which embrace a life
of all mankind the doctrine of Christ
would not be rejected either by Jews
Buddhists Muslims or others even if they
doubted the truth to their own Creed
still less can be rejected by our own
Christian world which is no other moral
law the doctrine of Christ does not
disagree with men in respect to their
views of life but including it gives
them what is wanting in it what is
indispensable it points out to them a
path that is not a new one but one
familiar to them from their childhood
you are a believer
whatever Creed you may profess you
believe in the creation in the world and
the Trinity in the fall and the
redemption of man
in the sacraments in the efficacy of
prayer or in the church Christ's
doctrine does not tell you that your
Creed is wrong it only gives it what is
wanting while you keep to your present
Creed you feel at the life of the world
in your own life are full of evil and
you see no way of escaping that evil the

being the teaching of your God gives you
simple rules that will deliver you and
others from that evil believe in
resurrection from the dead believe in
paradise in Hell in the Pope in the
church pray as your Creed and joins you
to do keep the fast sing psalms and all
this does not prevent you from
fulfilling what Christ tells you to do
in order to attain crew happiness namely
avoid anger do not commit adultery do
not swear do not defend yourself by
violence and never make war
it may perhaps happen that you will not
always fulfill all of this you will
yield to temptation and transgress one
of these laws just as you violate the
rules of the civil law or the laws of a
good breeding you will perhaps in a
moment of impulse swerve from the rules
laid down by Christ but in your calmer
moments do not act as you do now do not
organize your life in a way that renders
are difficult to avoid anger and
adultery to abstain from swearing and
using violence or making war but
organize it in a way that should all
make things difficult to do you must
admit the duty of acting thus for these
are the commandments of God you are
perhaps an unbeliever or a philosopher
you say that all goes on in the world
according to law that you have
discovered the doctrine of Christ fully
acknowledges the law that you have
discovered but independent of this law
which will bring good to mankind after
thousands of years is your own
individual life now you have no rules at
all for your own individual life except

and enforce by the police the doctrine
of Christ gives you rules that decidedly
agree with your law for your law of
altruism is nothing but a bad purpose
for the doctrine of Christ or you are
neither a believer nor an unbeliever you
have no time to seek the purpose of life
and you have no definite Creed it is
enough for you that you act as all
others do the Christ doctrine says in
effect to you you are unable to verify
the truth of the doctrine
preach to you you find it easier to
follow the example of those around you
but however humble you may be in mind
you have to judge in your heart who
sometimes makes you feel that you have
acted rightly and another time shows
that you are wrong however modest your
lot maybe you cannot help someone and
asking yourself ought I to act is all
around me do or according to my own
feeling and no sooner does the question
arise in your mind then the precepts of
Christ are found to answer both your
reason and your conscience if you are
more a believer than an unbeliever you
act accordingly to the will of God by
following the precepts of Christ if you
are more of free thinker than a believer
by obeying God's precepts you follow the

because the precepts of Christ bear
